title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned if the correct two x-values are given: x = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3859@ and x=4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGinaiaac6caaaa@36A5@

Endpoints or points outside the interval 0<x<6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37D1@ will not be penalized.

If any other internal points are identified as critical points or if only one critical point is given, the point is not earned.

If given as an ordered pair, the correct y-value is required to earn the point: ( 2,  g ( 2 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFF@ and ( 4,  g ( 4 ) ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EB3@ or ( 2,  1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A37@ and ( 4,  5 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AEF@

The critical points maybe presented as a set: { 2,  4 }. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B94@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Correct classification and justification of each of the two correct critical points earns one point each, subject to the following issues.

The response must address all of the points inside the interval 0<x<6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37D1@ identified in part (a).

· Do not read justification for points outside the interval 0<x<6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37D1@ (e.g., endpoints).

· If an extra interior point is given in part (a), then the response is only eligible for one point. To earn the one point, both remaining critical points must be correctly classified and explained.

· Incorrect interior points in part (a) must be identified as neither a minimum nor a maximum.

The response may identify relative minimum as absolute minimum or simply minimum.

If the response only presented one critical point in part (a), then the response is only eligible for one point in part (b), with a correct answer and justification of that one critical point.

The response may “restart” and come up with our two critical points even if only one or no critical points were listed in part (a). In this case two points could possibly be earned.

Proper use of the Second Derivative Test is an acceptable justification for the minimum at x=2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaacYcaaaa@36A1@ but is insufficient for x=4. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI0aGaaiOlaaaa@36C5@

Insufficient justifications because of poor communication:

· The derivative changes signs, so it is a relative minimum.

· “it” changes from negative to positive at x=2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiilaaaa@36C1@ so it is a relative minimum.

Invalid reasons:

· g ″ (4)=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B74@ so x=4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaI0aaaaa@3613@ is neither.

· g is negative before 2 and then positive after 2, so x=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaaaaa@3611@ is a minimum.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

First point:

To earn the first point we must see a trapezoidal sum. The minimum requirement for the correct form is that we must see a quotient (to produce the average height) and a product with the width for each trapezoid. The width of 1 can be implied.

Examples of sufficient forms which would earn the first point:

· ( g( 0 )+g( 2 ) 2 )2+( g( 2 )+g( 3 ) 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4957@

· ( 5+1 2 )2+( 1+3 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FC5@

· ( 6 2 )2+( 4 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8D@

Examples of insufficient forms which would not earn the first point:

· 1 2 ( g( 0 )+2g( 2 )+g( 3 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@432E@

· ( 3 )2+( 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A74@

A generic trapezoidal formula does not earn this point; the response must address the function at the specified values and the different trapezoid widths.

Each trapezoid may be done together or in separate pieces but must be combined in a sum to earn the first point.

If exactly three of the four pieces of the trapezoidal sum are correct, the response will earn the first (form) point, but will be ineligible for the second (answer) point. Failure to divide by 2 in both terms would mean two of the four pieces are incorrect and would earn neither point. Examples:

· ( 5+1 2 )1+( 1+3 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FC4@ earns the first point, but does not earn the second point.

· ( 5+1 2 )2+( 1+2 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FC4@ earns the first point, but does earn the second point.

· ( g( 0 )+g( 2 ) )2+( g( 2 )+g( 3 ) 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@484D@ earns the first point, but does not earn the second point.

· ( 5+1 )2+ ( 1+3 2 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FC0@ earns the first point, but does not earn the second point.

· ( 5+1 )2+( 1+3 )1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D53@ earns no points.

Averaging a left Riemann sum and a right Riemann sum is an acceptable approach.

Equating the actual value of the integral with the approximation will not result in a loss of a point.

Second point:

The response must be the correct answer. The answer does not need to be simplified to 8. If simplified, it must be correct to earn the point.

Eligibility: The first point must have been earned to be eligible for the answer point.

The response must be numeric; the values for g ( 0 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E1@ g ( 2 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38E3@ and g ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3834@ must be pulled from the table.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

To earn the first point the response must state g ″ >0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabm4zayaagaGaeyOpa4JaaGimaiaac6caaaa@3961@

A statement about concavity must include a statement about g ″ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabm4zayaagaGaaiOlaaaa@379F@

A picture, graph, or sign chart without further explanation that includes a statement that g ″ >0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabm4zayaagaGaeyOpa4JaaGimaaaa@38AF@ does not earn the point.

Use of pronouns such as “it” or “the curve” are ambiguous and will not earn the point unless tied to words such as second derivative, g ″ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabm4zayaagaaaaa@36ED@ or g.

Intervals are not required to earn the first point. If presented, however, they must be 0<x<2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaikdaaaa@37AD@ and 2<x<3, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaiodacaGGSaaaaa@3860@ or 0<x<3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaeyipaWJaamiEaiabgYda8iaaiodaaaa@37AE@ to earn the first point.

Second point:

Eligibility: The response must have either g ″ (x)>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B05@ or concave up, and the conclusion of overestimate. The second point can be earned in this part without earning the first point. That is, if the response referenced concave up but not g ″ (x)>0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BB5@ then a correct answer will earn the answer point.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

Note that the bounds of integration are not considered for this point.

The type of responses that earn this point are:

· x  g ′  ( x )  |  0  6 − ∫ 0 6 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@51F9@

· x  g ′  ( x )  |  0  6 + ∫ 0 6 g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@51EE@

· x  g ′  ( x )− ∫ g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4839@

· x  g ′  ( x )+ ∫ g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@482E@

· x  g ′  ( x )±g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4237@

Note that any combination of use or no use of bounds on either the first or second terms is acceptable for the first point.

Second point:

Responses are eligible for the second point even if they did not earn the first point. The second point is awarded for correctly using the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus to conclude that ∫ 0 6 g ′  ( x )  dx =g ( 6 )−g ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CC0@ or ∫ 0 6 g ′  ( x )  dx =8−5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4530@

Note that it is not required to have the remaining terms from the integration by parts present or correct to earn this point.

A response that begins with a correct presentation of all terms resulting from evaluation of the integral by integration by parts will earn the integration by parts point and the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point. Note that the term 0 ⋅  g ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E99@ must be present.

· 6 g ′  ( 6 )−0 ⋅  g ′  ( 0 )−( g ( 6 )−g ( 0 ) )  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@53C0@ earns the first two points.

· 6 g ′  ( 6 )−0−( g ( 6 )−g ( 0 ) )  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4914@ earns the first two points.

· 6 g ′  ( 6 )−( g ( 6 )−g ( 0 ) )  MathType@MTEF@5@5@@476D@ does not earn the first point, but does earn the second point.

Third point:

The response must be the correct answer. The answer does not need to be simplified to 15. If there is simplification, it must be correct to earn this point.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned for the correct answer.

Coefficients do not need to be simplified but if simplified, it must have been done correctly to earn the point.

The point is not earned if there is anything beyond the quadratic term (higher order terms or + ⋯ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHRaWkcaaMe8UaeS47IWeaaa@378F@ indicating a series).
